Microsoft’s Developer Division (“DevDiv”) is chartered with empowering every developer and every development team on the planet to build great software faster. The Azure Developer Experience (DevEx) Growth team is seeking a Principal Technical Program Manager to coordinate the strategy and execution of an evolved “application architecture patterns” guidance initiative, in support of the continuing success of our developer-centric cloud application platform. This highly influential position will impact Microsoft’s platform business globally through the delivery of a portfolio of reusable assets, broad evangelism across stakeholders, and associated platform growth. 

 

Our application platform is comprised of Azure App Service, Azure Functions, Azure Container Apps, Azure API Management, Azure Logic Apps, and more. We are focused on maximizing developer productivity while maintaining strict security, reliability, and scalability standards. The Application Platform Growth team is charged with driving the growth of the platform by collaborating with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to deeply understand customer needs to distill a prioritized set of product capabilities; communicate platform value and key competitive differentiators; and empower them through guidance, reference architectures, code samples, and deployable stacks. 

 

One aspect of our charter is to deliver a strong reciprocal collaboration process with the Azure sales force (“field”). To be successful partnering with the field we need to provide them with the right tools and content catered to what customers are expecting to see and which will accelerate their journey to build and deploy applications on the platform. Collectively, this work will be delivered via a set of application architecture patterns that consist of usage scenarios, reference implementations, deployable stacks, and customer references.

Across the industry, developers are increasingly diversifying the languages they use, platforms they target, and types of applications they build. Microsoft’s Developer Division (DevDiv) delivers tools to make all developers successful and productive in building all types of applications in any language for any platform. The DevDiv UX Research Team brings a world-class UX to Visual Studio, .NET, and Azure. Millions of developers around the world use these tools every day to build rich applications and use is growing at a phenomenal rate. The applications built span web, mobile, desktop, cloud, gaming, machine learning, and Internet of Things.

You will have access to a new, state of the art, modern research lab facility equipped for a variety of research types located in a central hub area on campus. You will use remote tools incorporating the latest technology to collaborate with a distributed team and to execute research on a global customer base.

 

This is a unique opportunity to grow in your career during this period of transformation. Join us and help re-invent the future of the developer experience in this exciting era. Join us!

 

Developer Division supports our employees in all locations around the country. This job has the option to be fully remote or located in one of our hubs: Redmond, WA; Austin, TX; Raleigh, NC; Atlanta, GA; Boston, MA; or San Francisco, CA/Bay Area.

Estimates are that the global population of developers will be 45 million in 2030.  That’s an increase of 18 million developers from today.  Each of these developers brings with them ideas and innovations that they’d like to share with the world.  They need world-class products, services, and tooling that enable them to seamlessly move from idea to code to cloud.  

 

About the Role 

 

DevDiv is looking for a Product Manager (PM) interested in helping to achieve this vision and improve the developer experiences for everyone using any language.  This role is best suited for a PM who is passionate about technology, thoughtfully analytical in understanding customer requirements and competitive context, and eager to drive tangible business impact in a collaborate team. You will need to collaborate across organizations to ensure extraordinary experiences across tools, cloud hosting, and customer outreach. Technical proficiency and problem solving are must haves to understand customer pain points and communicate effectively with the development team. Your role will require making decisions regarding trade-offs and challenges with app development so previous experience in developer tools would be beneficial. 

 

About Us 

 

Microsoft’s Developer Division (“DevDiv”) is chartered with empowering every developer and every development team on the planet to build great software faster.  We build developer platforms, tools and services to enable anyone from citizen developers to seasoned professional developers to be successful in realizing their software’s potential from local to cloud development.  We also build cloud services optimized for running developer workloads in the cloud, such as Azure Functions, Azure Container Apps and Azure App Services.  These tools and services play a critical role in the success of platforms and solutions ensuring that developers can be productive, work how and where they want, and have reliable and high performance set of tools at their disposal.  The tools we build are the Visual Studio family (Visual Studio, Visual Studio for Mac, Visual Studio Code), IntelliCode, runtimes (.NET and Java), compilers, SDKs, languages, testing platforms/tools, package management, and critical developer services to help deliver these experiences. 

 

This is a remote friendly team, but we would be happy to offer a hybrid work experience as well!
